nodes.details:
Print N Rows Node Details


This node is used to print the first N rows from the incoming dataframe.

The Number of rows that needs to be printed can be configured in the node.

Input Parameters

  • OUTPUT STORAGE LEVEL : Keep this as DEFAULT.
  • TITLE : Enter a short description for the type of information being displayed.
  • NUM ROWS TO PRINT : Set an integer value(N) which controls the number of rows to be displayed(Default N=10).
  • DISPLAY DATA TYPE : Shows the output dataframe column datatypes by default.

Output

  • This node can be used to view, analyze and validate the output of the Dataframe.

fields.value:
Analyzing Streaming Text Data using Socket Connection


  • This workflow reads in streaming text data from a socket every 30 seconds.
  • Host : localhost Port : 9999
  • It then prints out the first 10 rows of the incoming data every 30 seconds.
  • You will first need to run Netcat (a small utility found in most Unix-like systems) as a data server by using: nc -lk 9999
  • More details are available at : https://spark.apache.org/docs/3.5.3/structured-streaming-programming-guide.html#content
  • Sparkflows also comes with streamfile.py under the scripts directory. streamfile.py reads in the given input text file, and outputs one line at a time and then sleeps for 1 second.
  • You can stream a file (eg: testfile.txt) into netcat with the below command: python streamfile.py testfile.txt| nc -lk 9999
